content: CPF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Nov 2018Does voluntary top up to our CPF MA counts towards reduced income tax? Or does it only count for CPF SA top up?4 answersAnswerBump0

MasterAnswered on 22 Nov 2018For CPF MA top-up,If you are an employee, you can write in to your HR to credit more into your medisave (which also allows them additional 1% tax relief for the company), while you enjoy tax relief from the employment.If you are a self-employed, yes, you will enjoy reduced income tax (depending on your tax bracket). You must declare your self-employment to CPF too.CPF SA top up confirm counts towards tax-relief (ceveat, its only reserved for FRS, can't use it for BRS).0 comments0

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 22 Nov 2018Top up of CPF MA counts too! Here's some conditions by IRAS:
Tax Relief for Voluntary ContributionsYou may claim tax relief for your voluntary Medisave contributions if:You are a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident;You have made voluntary contributions to your Medisave account in the previous year; andYou derived any source of income (e.g. from rental, director's fees, etc.) in the year you made the voluntary contributions.0 comments0
